response: Buses need to run more frequently, especially during rush hour.
The schedule says every 15 minutes but I've been waiting here for 35 minutes. Real-time tracking would help but only if it's accurate.
Service is pretty reliable during the day, but evenings and weekends are terrible.
I rely on the 7:45 AM bus to get to work on time, but it's late at least twice a week.
24/7 service on main routes would be amazing for shift workers.
The buses bunch up - three come at once then nothing for an hour.
Sunday service is basically non-existent.
I can't plan my day around transit because it's so unpredictable.
Holiday schedules are confusing and poorly communicated.
More express routes during peak hours would reduce overcrowding.
Better lighting at bus stops - some areas feel unsafe at night.
Too many incidents of harassment and no security presence.
Emergency call buttons on buses would make me feel safer.
The downtown station is well-lit and feels secure, but suburban stops are sketchy.
Transit police presence would help with disruptive passengers.
Women-only cars during late night hours.
CCTV cameras are good but they need to be visible as a deterrent.
I avoid certain routes because of safety concerns.
Better communication during emergencies or security incidents.
Safe, well-lit walking paths to transit stops.
Wheelchair ramps that actually work properly.
Audio announcements are too quiet - I can never hear the stops.
Priority seating rules need to be enforced, not just suggested.
As a parent with a stroller, the buses are nearly impossible to navigate.
Better signage in Braille and large print for visually impaired riders.
The bus doors close too quickly for elderly passengers.
Accessible bathrooms at major transit hubs.
Low-floor buses make such a difference for mobility aid users.
Driver training on disability awareness and assistance.
Multiple language announcements for our diverse community.
The buses smell terrible and the seats are always dirty.
Broken glass and litter at every bus stop.
The windows are so dirty you can't see outside.
Escalators at the main station have been broken for months.
Regular deep cleaning of vehicles, not just surface wiping.
Bus stop shelters need better maintenance and graffiti removal.
The ticket machines are always out of order.
Proper drainage at bus stops - they flood every time it rains.
The vehicles sound like they're about to break down.
Clean bathrooms at transit centers that are actually maintained.
Monthly passes are too expensive for low-income families.
Student discounts should be available year-round, not just during school.
Senior fares are reasonable, but the payment system is confusing.
Why can't I just tap my credit card like other cities?
Free transfers between different transit systems.
The fare structure is too complicated - just make it simple.
Day passes should work on all types of transit, not just buses.
Sliding scale pricing based on income would help working families.
The transit cards expire too quickly and cost too much to replace.
Exact change only is ridiculous in 2025.
No service to the new residential developments on the east side.
Everything goes downtown but nothing connects the suburbs directly.
Need a route to the airport that doesn't cost $50 in a taxi.
Better connections between bus and train lines - the transfer points are too far apart.
Service to the university campus shouldn't take 90 minutes from downtown.
Routes to major hospitals and medical centers.
The industrial area where I work has no transit access.
More direct routes instead of these ridiculous detours.
Service to the shopping center and big box stores.
Connect neighboring cities with regional transit.
The metal seats are incredibly uncomfortable for any trip longer than 10 minutes.
Buses are either freezing cold or boiling hot - no in between.
Covered bus stops that actually protect from rain and wind.
Free WiFi would make commute time more productive.
More benches and seating at bus stops for elderly passengers.
The buses shake so much over potholes I get motion sick.
Heated shelters for winter weather.
Better ventilation - the air quality is terrible especially in summer.
USB charging ports for phones and devices.
The seating layout is awkward and doesn't maximize space efficiently.
The transit app crashes constantly and gives wrong arrival times.
Real-time tracking that's actually accurate, not 15 minutes off.
Mobile ticket purchasing that works reliably.
Digital displays at stops showing actual arrival times.
The GPS tracking is wrong more often than it's right.
Contactless payment like tap-to-pay cards.
Better announcements - the speaker system is from the 1980s.
QR codes for easy schedule and route information.
The website is impossible to navigate and find simple information.
Push notifications for service delays and changes.
Bus drivers are sometimes rude and impatient with passengers.
Customer service at the transit office is helpful and friendly.
Drivers need better training on routes - they often don't know stops or detours.
Lost and found service that actually helps recover items.
The phone system for complaints and questions is a nightmare.
Some drivers are great and really care about passengers, others seem miserable.
Better communication during service disruptions.
Drivers rush through stops and don't wait for running passengers.
More responsive feedback system for complaints and suggestions.
Driver appreciation - they deal with a lot and deserve recognition.
Electric buses would reduce noise and air pollution.
Better integration with bike lanes and cycling infrastructure.
Solar panels on bus stops and transit facilities.
The diesel fumes from old buses are terrible for air quality.
Bike racks on all buses for multi-modal transportation.
Hybrid or electric vehicles to reduce environmental impact.
Partner with car-sharing services for last-mile connectivity.
More efficient routing to reduce fuel consumption and emissions.
Green building standards for new transit facilities.
Promote transit as climate action - make it the obvious choice over driving.
Buses are always late, especially during rush hour when I need them most.
Service every 30 minutes isn't frequent enough for daily commuting.
The weekend schedule is so limited it's basically useless.
Holiday service information needs to be clearer and more accessible.
Express service during peak hours would reduce travel time significantly.
Late night service for people who work evening shifts.
The buses bunch up instead of maintaining consistent spacing.
Snow and weather delays are understandable but communication is poor.
I've given up on transit because I can't rely on it for important appointments.
More frequent service would reduce overcrowding on popular routes.
Drug activity and open substance use make me feel unsafe.
The emergency call buttons don't seem to work or get responses.
Well-lit stops make a huge difference for evening commutes.
Security cameras are good but need visible monitoring.
Panic buttons and emergency communication systems need improvement.
Some routes feel safe, others I wouldn't take after dark.
Transit staff should be trained in de-escalation techniques.
Better coordination with police for incident response.
Safe walking routes to transit stops are just as important.
Metal detectors at major stations might help with safety concerns.
The wheelchair lift breaks down constantly and isn't maintained.
Visual announcements for deaf and hard-of-hearing passengers.
Space for wheelchairs is often blocked by strollers or luggage.
Tactile strips and guides for visually impaired navigation.
The gap between platform and bus is too wide for mobility aids.
Service animals should have designated space on vehicles.
Accessible route information in multiple formats.
Priority boarding enforcement for people who need extra time.
Elevators at transit stations are frequently out of service.
Staff training on helping passengers with various disabilities.
The floors are sticky and haven't been properly cleaned in ages.
Graffiti removal happens but new tags appear immediately.
The air conditioning system smells moldy and probably needs replacement.
Regular maintenance schedules should be posted so we know what to expect.
Vandalism and broken windows make the whole system look neglected.
Power washing of platforms and waiting areas is desperately needed.
The smell on some buses is so bad I'd rather walk.
Preventive maintenance would save money compared to emergency repairs.
Hand sanitizer stations at major stops and on vehicles.
Deep cleaning protocols especially after incidents or illnesses.
The fare is reasonable but payment options are limited and outdated.
Family passes would make transit more affordable for households with kids.
Employer subsidies for transit passes would encourage more ridership.
The cost compared to driving isn't competitive when you factor in time.
Income-based pricing would help low-income residents access jobs and services.
Loading money onto transit cards is inconvenient and expensive.
Free transit during air quality alerts would encourage environmental behavior.
The payment machines don't give change and often don't work.
Price transparency - hidden fees and confusing fare structures are frustrating.
Transit should be free for essential trips like medical appointments.
The route map is confusing and doesn't match actual service patterns.
Cross-town connections require going downtown first, adding 45 minutes.
Service to the community college requires two transfers and takes forever.
Park and ride lots at suburban stations would increase ridership.
The new shopping center has no transit access despite being a major destination.
Better coordination between different transit agencies and systems.
Circular routes connecting suburban neighborhoods directly.
Transit to recreational areas like parks and hiking trails.
The airport connection is expensive and takes longer than driving.
Service to major employment centers outside downtown.
Padded seats would make longer journeys much more comfortable.
The lighting inside buses is too dim for reading or feeling safe.
Temperature consistency - some buses are arctic, others are saunas.
Luggage racks for people traveling to airports or carrying shopping.
The constant engine noise makes conversation impossible.
Cup holders and small conveniences would improve the experience.
Facing-forward seats instead of the awkward side-facing configuration.
Weather protection at stops is inadequate - I get soaked waiting.
Better handholds and grab bars for standing passengers.
The suspension system needs work - every bump is jarring.
Trip planning features that actually work and include real-time updates.
The electronic displays show wrong information more often than correct.
Offline maps and schedules for when cell service is poor.
Integration with navigation apps like Google Maps.
Automated announcements that are clear and at appropriate volume.
Digital ticketing that works across all devices and platforms.
Real-time capacity information so I know if buses are full.
Service alerts and updates via text message or push notifications.
The wifi is so slow it's essentially useless.
Modern payment systems like Apple Pay and Google Pay.
The information desk staff are knowledgeable and helpful with route planning.
Complaint resolution takes forever and often gets no response.
Some drivers go above and beyond to help passengers, others are indifferent.
Customer service hours don't match when people actually need help.
Online chat support would be more convenient than phone calls.
Driver courtesy training would improve the overall experience.
Clear escalation process for serious complaints or safety issues.
Multilingual customer service to serve our diverse community.
Follow-up on feedback to show that suggestions are actually considered.
Recognition programs for excellent drivers and staff.
Hydrogen fuel cells could be the future for zero-emission transit.
Tree planting and green infrastructure around transit stops.
Carbon offset programs for remaining emissions.
Electric charging infrastructure for personal devices using renewable energy.
Partnership with environmental groups to promote sustainable transportation.
Recycling programs on vehicles and at stations.
Energy-efficient LED lighting throughout the transit system.
Biodiesel or other alternative fuels for existing fleet.
Green roof systems on transit facilities for environmental benefits.
Make transit the environmentally obvious choice over single-occupancy vehicles.
